meanings.definition: The act of wiping out or erasing something completely.
meanings.sent1: After the big storm, there were many wipeouts of the sandcastles on the beach.
meanings.sent2: The wipeouts of the whiteboard were so thorough that not a single word was left.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved a wipeout of the drawing on the paper, leaving the audience amazed.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush created a wipeout of colors, blending them into a beautiful masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The wipeout of the old graffiti made the wall look fresh and clean again.

meanings.definition: A total failure or disaster, especially in sports or business.
meanings.sent1: The team's multiple wipeouts in the championship game led to their defeat.
meanings.sent2: The company faced a financial wipeout after the stock market crash.
meanings.sent3: The bake sale was a wipeout when all the cookies got burnt in the oven.
meanings.sent4: The entrepreneur experienced a wipeout in his business venture, losing all his investments.
meanings.sent5: The student's presentation was a wipeout, with technical issues and forgotten lines.
